verses.text: On this mountain the Lord of Hosts will prepare for all the nations a feast of pieces fat, a feast of wine on the lees – fat pieces full of marrow, and wine on the lees well strained.
He will rend on this mountain the veil that enwrapped the face of all nations.

He will swallow up death for ever. And then will swallow up death for ever. And then will the Lord God wipe tears from every face, and remove from off the earth the reproach that has clung to his people. The Lord himself has decreed it.
The Lord, you are my God; I exalt you, I praise your name: for a marvellous thing you have done, long purposed, now come to fulfilment.
You have made of a city a heap, of a fortified city a ruin; the palace of pride is a city no more, it will not be rebuilt for ever.
For this will fierce nations own your glory, the city of tyrants will fear you.
For unto the weak you have proved you a stronghold, a stronghold were you to the poor in his straits – a refuge from storm and a shadow from heat.
You subdued the voice of the proud, and you humbled the song of the tyrant.
That day it will be said: behold! This is our God, for whom we have waited – to save us. This is the Lord for whom we have waited, O let us rejoice and be glad – he has saved us.
For here upon this mountain the hand of the Lord will rest; and Moab will be trampled in the place whereon he stands, as straw in a dung-pit is trampled,
should he spread forth his hands.
